advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: This breakneck chapter in the Riptide GP series is so intense, it’s got us reaching for a life jacket. Or maybe several: Renegade’s solo campaign packs tons of water-racing events and sick tricks to master. (Split-screen local and eight-player online matches are our favorites.) However you play, stunning tracks like a gorgeous forest river deliver awesome arcade thrills. On Apple TV, it's our 2016 Game of the Year.
editorialNotes.short: Manage your speed and watch out for waves in this brilliant water-racing sequel.

editorialNotes.standard: In Hello Games' side-scrolling racer, you control the eponymous stunt devil as he jumps, wheelies, and backflips through a huge assortment of death-defying levels. With tricks to master, costumes to unlock, and leaderboards to conquer, Joe Danger is a wacky blast. You’ll don an Elvis getup, evade flying saucers, and soar over shark tanks in increasingly treacherous tracks. After all, they don’t call him Joe Danger for nothing.

Developer Jan Ilavsky came up with the idea for this gorgeous Apple Design Award winner after he’d broken his arm. He started on an infinite runner that could be played one-handed, and since he’s also colorblind, he added a gameplay element about changing between vibrant neon colors. Chameleon Run succeeds beautifully, balancing wicked speed with irresistible, just-one-more-try challenges.
editorialNotes.short: You'll need quick reactions in this intense polychromatic platformer.

editorialNotes.standard: Unleash your inner daredevil with Hello Games’ electrifying new racing game, a fast-paced side-scroller bursting with fun challenges. As miniature stuntman Joe Danger and his crew of wacky drivers, you’ll pop wheelies, sail off ramps, and even repel missiles and UFOs, snagging collectibles as you go for maximum points. With responsive controls and colorful stages, it'll hook anyone who appreciates an action-packed joyride.

name: Flight Unlimited Las Vegas - Flight Simulator

editorialNotes.standard: An absolutely blistering sensation of speed lies at the core of this intriguing mash-up of racing game and infinite runner. As you guide a futuristic ship toward the horizon by tapping either side of the screen to steer, you have to whip around obstacles and snare energy boosts to stay alive. Some sessions are over in seconds, some triumphantly stretch into minutes. Spare, modern graphics set the perfect mood as you inevitably become obsessed with zooming just a little bit farther on your next run.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: A Fun Racing Game for Kids!
